intro: Parathesis multiflora, commonly known as the clustered parathesis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its丛生 (clumped) growth habit and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually greenish-white in color and bloom during the spring and early summer months.
